text: Quan River photoed at 11:53 a.m on May 18th,2017 The Quan River is a major river in Henan province of China. It is the largest tributary of the Ying River which is a part of the Huai River watershed system. Its total length is about 241 km, 120 km of which in the upstream section is also called Fen River. It flows into the Ying River in Anhui province. ==References== Category:Rivers of Henan
title: Quan River
